metadata.name: Flush Iptables Ufw Chain
metadata.comment: Detect use of iptables to flush all firewall rules, tables and chains and allow all network traffic

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/iptables')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/xtables-legacy-multi')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/iptables-legacy-multi')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/ip6tables')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/ip6tables-legacy-multi'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-f')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-z')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-x'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ufw-logging-deny')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ufw-logging-allow')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ufw6-logging-deny')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ufw6-logging-allow'))))

output.summary: Detect use of iptables to flush all firewall rules, tables and chains and allow all network traffic

metadata.objective: False positive: Network administrators References: https://blogs.blackberry.com/, https://www.cyberciti.biz/tips/linux-iptables-how-to-flush-all-rules.html, https://twitter.com/Joseliyo_Jstnk/status/1620131033474822144
